oilmm.oilmm module¶

class oilmm.oilmm.IGP(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: object

Independent GPs.

Parameters

  • kernels (list[stheno.Kernel]) – Kernels.

  • noises (vector) – Observation noises.

condition(x, y, w=None, x_ind=None)[source]¶

Condition the model.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Locations of training data.

  • y (matrix) – Observations of training data.

  • w (matrix, optional) – Weights of training data.

  • x_ind (matrix, optional) – Locations of inducing points.

logpdf(x, y, w=None, x_ind=None)[source]¶

Compute the logpdf.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Locations of training data.

  • y (matrix) – Observations of training data.

  • w (matrix, optional) – Weights of training data.

  • x_ind (matrix, optional) – Locations of inducing points.

Returns

Logpdf.

Return type

scalar

predict(x, latent=False, return_variances=False)[source]¶

Predict.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Input locations to predict at.

  • latent (bool, optional) – Predict noiseless processes. Defaults to False.

  • return_variances (bool, optional) – Return means and variances instead. Defaults to False.

Returns

Tuple containing means, lower 95% central credible bound,

and upper 95% central credible bound if variances is False, and means and variances otherwise.

Return type

tuple

sample(x, latent=False)[source]¶

Sample from the model.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Locations to sample at.

  • latent (bool, optional) – Sample noiseless processes. Defaults to False.

Returns

Sample.

Return type

matrix

class oilmm.oilmm.OILMM(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: object

Orthogonal Instantaneous Linear Mixing model.

Parameters

  • kernels (list[stheno.Kernel]) –

  • u (matrix) – Orthogonal part of the mixing matrix.

  • s_sqrt (matrix) – Diagonal part of the mixing matrix.

  • noise_obs (scalar) – Observation noise.

predict(x, latent=False, return_variances=False)[source]¶

Predict.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Input locations to predict at.

  • latent (bool, optional) – Predict noiseless processes. Defaults to False.

  • return_variances (bool, optional) – Return means and variances instead. Defaults to False.

Returns

Tuple containing means, lower 95% central credible

bound, and upper 95% central credible bound if variances is False, and means and variances otherwise.

Return type

tuple[matrix]

project(x, y)[source]¶

Project data.

Parameters

  • x (matrix) – Locations of data.

  • y (matrix) – Observations of data.

Returns

Tuple containing the locations of the projection,

the projection, weights associated with the projection, and a regularisation term.

Return type

tuple
